decl.description:
`furo-data-chart-binder`
 Connects data objects (repeaterNodes) with the charting lib.

 Use multiple binders if you need more then one series per chart.

 ```html
 <furo-chart-display chart-type="bar">
    <furo-data-chart-binder
        ƒ-bind-data="--projectDAO(*.entities)"
        data-field="data.cost_limit.units"
        category-field="data.description"
    ></furo-data-chart-binder>
 </furo-chart-display>
 ```
decl.name: FuroDataChartBinder

members.name: axisLabelOpposite
members.description: Put the axis label on the opposite site (usually right)

members.name: axisLabel
members.description: Text for the y axis

members.name: axisLabelColor
members.description: Custom color for the y axis description text

members.name: axisBorder
members.description: Show a border on the right side of the y axis descriptions and labels.

members.name: axisBorderColor
members.description: Custom color for the border.

members.name: axisTicks
members.description: Show tick marks on the y axis.

members.name: axisTooltip
members.description: Show a tooltip with the current value while hovering.

members.name: axisTicksColor
members.description: Custom color for the ticks

members.name: seriesName
members.description: Series with same name will get the same y-axis

members.name: legendLabel
members.description: Label the Series for the legend. This text is also shown on the tooltips. This is useful when you have more then one data series.

members.name: _convertData
members.description:
Prepares the data for the according chart display

some charts want 1 dimensional data (pie, donut) and others expect more dimensions (boxplot,...)

members.name: _pathGet

parameters.name: root
parameters.description: Object from which to dereference path from

members.description:
Reads a value from a path.  If any sub-property in the path is `undefined`,
this method returns `undefined` (will never throw.

members.name: strokeWidth
members.description: Define the thickness of the lines in px.

members.name: markerSize
members.description: Set the size of the markers (hover state) in px.

members.name: strokeCurve
members.description:
Define the curve style for line and area charts.

 Possible values: 'smooth', 'straight',  'stepline'

members.name: options
dataField
members.description:
Define the data field or fields here. For most charts this is **the y axis**.

Some charts requires more then one data field (i.e. bubbles want at least 3 fields `data-field="data.start.day, data.end.day, data.start.day"` ).

members.name: categoryField
members.description: Define the category field here (only 1 field). You can think of this as it is the x axis for your chart.

members.name: chartType
members.description:
**Use this for mixed charts scenarios only**, prefer to define the chart-type on the chart-display.
Specify the default type on the display and set the custom type on this binder.

members.name: chartColor
members.description: If you need to give an explicit color for the series you can use this attribute.

events.description: Fired when a marker for this data source was clicked
events.name: data-point-clicked

events.description: Fired when datasource has updated data
events.name: data-updated

attributes.name: data-field
attributes.description:
Define the data field or fields here. For most charts this is **the y axis**.

Some charts requires more then one data field (i.e. bubbles want at least 3 fields `data-field="data.start.day, data.end.day, data.start.day"` ).

attributes.name: category-field
attributes.description: Define the category field here (only 1 field). You can think of this as it is the x axis for your chart.

attributes.name: legend-label
attributes.description: Label the Series for the legend. This text is also shown on the tooltips. This is useful when you have more then one data series.

attributes.name: series-name
attributes.description: Series with same name will get the same y-axis

attributes.name: chart-type
attributes.description:
**Use this for mixed charts scenarios only**, prefer to define the chart-type on the chart-display.
Specify the default type on the display and set the custom type on this binder.

attributes.name: chart-color
attributes.description: If you need to give an explicit color for the series you can use this attribute.

attributes.name: axis-label-opposite
attributes.description: Put the axis label on the opposite site (usually right)

attributes.name: axis-label
attributes.description: Text for the y axis

attributes.name: axis-label-color
attributes.description: Custom color for the y axis description text

attributes.name: axis-border
attributes.description: Show a border on the right side of the y axis descriptions and labels.

attributes.name: axis-border-color
attributes.description: Custom color for the border.

attributes.name: axis-ticks
attributes.description: Show tick marks on the y axis.

attributes.name: axis-tooltip
attributes.description: Show a tooltip with the current value while hovering.

attributes.name: axis-ticks-color
attributes.description: Custom color for the ticks

attributes.name: chart-curve
attributes.description:
Define the curve style for line and area charts.

 Possible values: 'smooth', 'straight',  'stepline'

attributes.name: chart-stroke-width
attributes.description: Define the thickness of the lines in px.

attributes.name: chart-marker-size
attributes.description: Set the size of the markers (hover state) in px.

pkg.name: @furo/ui5
pkg.description: SAP UI5 Web Components data bindings for furo

scripts.docs:generate: npm run analyze:components && npm run analyze:typerenderer && ./scripts/cem.sh
